III. SYSTEMS-INPUTS
AND PROCESS

CHED-required
Laboratories
Not CHED-required laboratories Existing Existing

1. Up-to-date Collection of
Psychological Materials ✓

➢ Each laboratory
room is described as
follows:
Science laboratory is located in the
second floor of Martina S. Ferrer
Building. The chief purpose of the
laboratory is to provide appropriate
setting for scientific experiment and
research. The utilization of the
laboratory caters students with
conceptual and theoretical
knowledge to help them learn
scientific concepts, through
scientific methods, and to
understand the nature of science.
Laboratory works completed in the
laboratory facilities also give the
students the opportunity to
experience science by scientific
experiment procedures;

➢ Each laboratory
room is described as
follows:
it allows students to achieve
meaningful learning, scientific
theories and permits students to
translate theories to application.
For optimum learning experience,
tools are presented and accessible to
suit the needs of the methodology
of the experiment. Each laboratory
is furnished with demonstration
table and classroom tools like chairs
for initial and final laboratory
discussions which are all arranged
accordingly for conducive learning
environment.

➢ Each laboratory
room is described as
follows:
The computer laboratory is
located in the Renato P. Dragon
building. It is utilized to enhance
classroom curriculum through the
integration of technology during
laboratory classes and to give each
student the opportunity to
enhance their understanding in
using computer and software
programs that are appropriate for
their professional development.

➢ Each laboratory
room is described as
follows:
The Testing Room is also
located in the Renato P. Dragon
Building. It is used as a venue for
incoming students who will take
the entrance exam. The testing
room is presented with proper
ventilation and space to allow free
movement and a room conducive
for an exam. The Psychology
Room is also located in the Renato
P. Dragon. It is used for research
experimentation purposes of the
Psychology students.

a. All Laboratory
Manuals in actual use
are listed as follows:

IV. OUTCOMES
There are evidences
that laboratories and
shops are well-
equipped, functional,
and are conducive to
learning
Computer Laboratory

Cleaning and
Maintenance of
Computer Laboratory
is being conducted

Maintenance personnel
while cleaning and
fixing fixtures in the
laboratory

V. BEST PRACTICES
The laboratory serve as
an avenue to the
development of
students’ skills which is
vital for their
profession. In order
for it to perform its
functions, the
laboratory users abide
to sufficient practices
in order to maintain its
quality and to provide
students a well-pleasing
work area.

• At the beginning of the
semester, the students were
oriented with the guidelines they
should abide while working in
the laboratory.
• The students were oriented
with the location and use of the
first-aid kits, fire extinguishers
and other safety devices available
in the laboratory.
• Precautionary measures are
discussed before the proper
laboratory sessions.
• The use of various
laboratory tools and equipment
were demonstrated by the
laboratory technician and the
faculty among the students.

• In order to maintain
cleanliness in the laboratories,
the students were tasked to
weep the floor before and
after the class.
• The lights, air
conditioner and other
equipment were strictly
monitored/turned off right
after the class to minimize
the use of electricity with
exception to some equipment
placed within laboratory
premises which are under
use.

• Water and electrical
supply are always available
among laboratory rooms.
The students are encouraged
to maximize the use of these
supplies by preparing
framework or flow of work
during the conduction.
• Right before the
experiment starts, the
laboratory tables were
disinfected with disinfecting
agents.

• During the conduction
of the experiments, the
students are required to bring
their laboratory kit and wear
laboratory gowns, masks and
gloves most especially when
the students will handle
potentially harmful
substances and living
organisms.
• After performing the
experiments, the laboratory
tools and apparatuses used
were washed, dried and
properly returned to the
supply room.

• Every day, before and
after classes, the utility
personnel clean the
laboratory rooms and
maintain the arrangements
of chairs and tables and
other furniture in the
laboratory.
• The number of chairs in
the laboratory rooms was
minimized to allow mobility
while working.

• The utilization of the
laboratory rooms were
bounded to a limited number
of students each room to
maximize the capacity of the
laboratory.
⮚In using the laboratories
during periods beyond class
hours, a request letter
approved by the dean of the
requesting party should be
addressed to the laboratory
technician and the
department chair
beforehand

PARAMETER B.
EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, AND
MATERIALS

I. SYSTEMS-INPUTS
AND PROCESS
⮚ The equipment,
supplies and
materials are
available in the
laboratories and
shops

II. IMPLEMENTATION
⮚ There is a record of
utilization of the
laboratory supplies
and materials.

⮚ An inventory of
functional equipment
on CHED minimum
requirements is as
follows:

III. OUTCOMES
⮚ There is evidence that
laboratory
equipment, supplies,
and materials are
sufficient and wisely
utilized.

Click to see the file
Photos of Equipment
/Supplies/Materials
IV. BEST PRACTICES

⮚Equipment, supplies and
materials are the most
vital necessities in order to
work in the laboratory.
The quality of the
equipment and
availability of the supplies
and materials should be
maintained in order to
obtain valuable and
promising results from
the experiments. The
equipment, supplies and
materials in the laboratory
are maintained through
the following practices:

• Every beginning of the
semester, the students
were introduced with the
basic uses and functions of
various laboratory tools,
apparatuses and
equipment. Hands-on
training and practical
exams are also conducted
during laboratory sessions
under the supervision of
the faculty.

• Each laboratory
equipment has its own log
sheet which registers the
name of the user, time and
date of usage, supervising
personnel and the user’s
signature. It allows
monitoring of the use of
the equipment,
troubleshooting of the
possible occurring
problems and tracing of
the person responsible for
the possible occurring
problems.

• Acquisition of chemicals
available on the chemical
room is also recorded in log
sheets. The log sheet records
the name of the user, time and
date of acquisition, amount of
chemical acquired, supervising
personnel and the user’s
signature. This allows
monitoring the amount of
chemicals and estimating its
availability on its succeeding
usage. This allows the
laboratory technician to
prepare the purchase request
for the chemicals with
depleting amount beforehand.

• Reservation on the use of
laboratory equipment and tools
is implemented among students
to impose discipline. This also
allows the laboratory technician
t prepare and estimate the
materials available beforehand.
In case of scarcity, the
technician prioritizes and
provides alternatives.
• The number and
availability laboratory supplies,
equipment and materials are
frequently subjected to
inventory for estimating the
specific number of pieces
needed for purchase request.

• The faculty always
coordinate with the
laboratory technician to
monitor the materials
necessary for the upcoming
conductions of
experiments.
• A stock of accessories
for certain laboratory
equipment is available
under the supervision of
the laboratory technician.

• Demonstrations of
different brands of
laboratory equipment from
different suppliers are
always conducted within the
laboratory premises. This
allows the laboratory
management to canvass
laboratory equipment with
the better quality and suits
the budget allotted.

BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN
PSYCHOLOGY
LEVEL 1
Program Performance
Profile
AREA IX.
LABORATORIES
PARAMETER C.
MAINTENANCE

I. SYSTEMS-INPUTS
AND PROCESS
⮚ Competent staff are
assigned in the
upkeep of the
laboratory

Click to see the file
Resume of Psychology
Laboratory and Testing
Room Technician
Resume of Science
Laboratory Technician
Resume of Computer
Laboratory Technician

⮚ There is available
maintenance and
repair unit in the
campus.

II. IMPLEMENTATIO
N
⮚ The maintenance
system of the
laboratories and
equipment is
described briefly as
follows:

1. Science Laboratory
The laboratory custodian
maintains the organization of
laboratories and the condition of
every tool and equipment.
Ocular inspection is always
conducted to find and replace
the tools especially the
consumable such as litmus
paper, alcohol, and the like.
During usage, malfunction of
equipment or tools are directly
reported to the laboratory
custodian who performs
necessary remedy; in case of
total malfunction, the problem is
submitted to the campus
maintenance group.

1. Science Laboratory
Inventory of tools which are
commonly used in laboratory
classes is frequently conducted.
Tools and equipment that have
been lost which are proven to be
the students’ negligence are
recorded and the responsible
student should replace the exact
same tool as soon as possible.

1. Science Laboratory
The laboratory management
requests for services to the
Physical Plant Services office of
the campus every time there are
problems happening in the
physical facility. The common
services rendered by PPS are
electrical maintenance, roof and
window repair, and installation
of equipment. The cleanliness of
the laboratory is maintained by
the students before and after the
class, as well as the utility
personnel.

2. Computer Laboratory
Schedule of general cleaning and
maintenance of all computers in
computer laboratory was
conducted every semestral break
specifically two weeks after the
final examination.
3. Psychology Room
Schedule of general cleaning and
maintenance of all materials was
conducted every semestral break
specifically two weeks after the
final examination.

⮚ Safety devices are
available.
Laboratory Safety Quantity
Device
Computer First Aid kit 1
Laboratory Fire 1
Science extinguisher
Laboratory First Aid kit 1
Fire 1 Psychology extinguisher
Room
Fire 1 Testing
Room extinguisher

III. OUTCOMES
⮚ The laboratories and
shops are functional
and are properly
maintained.

Functional computers
in the computer
laboratory

Cleaning and
Maintenance of
Computer Laboratory
is being conducted

Maintenance personnel
while cleaning and
fixing fixtures in the
laboratory

IV. BEST PRACTICES
⮚ The laboratory
technician
maintains the
orderliness of
laboratories and the
quality of the
equipment.

• Visual monitoring is
always conducted to find
and replace the tools
especially the glassware that
are no longer sufficient for
use.
• The laboratory
technician always performs
trouble shooting when the
equipment malfunctions. A
test run is conducted when
the equipment will be used.

• Chemicals, tools and
apparatuses which are
commonly used in classes are
frequently subjected to
inventory.
• The students were
obliged to return the
materials and tools borrowed
from the supply room in
accordance to the period of
their classes. If the use
exceeds their period, verbal
agreement is done or through
request letter addressed to the
department chair and the
laboratory technician.

• Tools and equipment that
have been damaged due to
students’ negligence will be
recorded in the laboratory
technician’s log book and the
student should immediately
replace or compensate the
damaged cause.
• If the damage on tools and
equipment were caused by
accident or due to the
experimental methodology, the
students will not be held liable.
The laboratory technician will
report the damage to the
immediate supervisor.

• The laboratory
management requests from the
suppliers and other external
institution for the periodic
calibration and cleaning of
high-end laboratory equipment
and tools.
Electrical maintenance, roof and
window repair, installation of
equipment, water supply
maintenance and other repair
services are rendered by the
Physical Plant Services office of
the University.

• The cleanliness of the
laboratory rooms is
maintained by the utility
personnel every day.
• The students were tasked
for maintaining the cleanliness
of their working area during
their classes.
• Waste segregation is
observed within the facilities
of the department. Labeled
trash bins are used for disposal
of solid wastes.

Chemical wastes are
temporarily stored within the
fume hood to avoid
contamination and the
management calls request for
disposal to an external
institution.
• Non-hazardous
biodegradable wastes such as
recently dissected animal
organs and plant body parts
were buried or disposed in the
compost pits.

IV. BEST PRACTICES

⮚ The laboratory technician
frequently inventories the
available materials and
tools in the supply room.
⮚ The laboratory technician
prepares purchase request
for materials needed to be
replaced or replenished.

⮚ Demonstrations of different
brands of laboratory
equipment from different
suppliers are always
conducted with in the
laboratory premises. This
allows the laboratory
management to canvass
laboratory equipment with
the better quality and suits
the budget allotted.

⮚ The canvassed equipment
was included in the PPMP
and APP.
⮚ In using the laboratories
during periods beyond class
hours, a request letter
approved by the dean of the
requesting party should be
addressed to the laboratory
technician and the
department chair
beforehand.

⮚ Each laboratory equipment
has its own log sheet which
registers the name of the user,
time and date of usage,
supervising personnel and the
user’s signature. It allows
monitoring of the use of the
equipment, troubleshooting of
the possible occurring
problems and tracing of the
person responsible for the
possible occurring problems.

⮚ Acquisition of chemicals
available on the chemical
rooms is also recorded in log
sheets. The log sheet records
the name of the user, and the
date of acquisition, amount of
chemical acquired, supervising
personnel and the user’s
signature. This allows
monitoring the amount of
chemical and estimating its
availability on its succeeding
usage. This allows the
laboratory technician to
prepare the purchase requests
for the chemicals with
depleting amount beforehand.

⮚ The students were required to
have a personal online account
for accessing their student
profile, grades, status and other
liabilities.
⮚ The students utilizing speech
and computer laboratories were
allowed to access the internet
for purposes of research and
compliance of requirements for
their courses.
⮚ The students utilize the
multimedia equipment on the
laboratories for presenting
their data gathered on the
laboratory experiments.
